Apple___Apple_scab: Olive-green or brown spots on leaves and fruit.
Fruit develops rough, scabby lesions reducing quality.
Apple___Black_rot: Circular brown spots with dark margins on leaves.
Fruit shows concentric black rings (‘bull’s-eye’ rot).
Cankers may form on branches or trunks.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Bright orange-yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces.
Gelatinous orange galls form on nearby cedar trees.
Leads to premature leaf drop and fruit deformity.
Apple___healthy: Leaf color is uniform green and glossy.
No visible spots, curling, or discoloration.
Tree exhibits normal growth and fruiting.
Blueberry___healthy: Leaves are smooth, bright green, and firm.
No spotting, curling, or fungal growth present.
Plant shows vigorous and balanced growth.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: Leaf is smooth, shiny, and vibrant green.
Tree shows strong flowering and fruiting.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: White, powdery fungal growth on upper leaf surface.
Leaves curl upward and growth becomes stunted.
Common in dry, warm conditions with poor airflow.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot: Small gray to tan rectangular lesions on leaves.
Lesions merge, killing large leaf areas.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust: Small reddish-brown pustules on both sides of leaves.
Heavy infection leads to leaf drying and yield loss.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Long, cigar-shaped gray-green lesions on leaves.
Develops rapidly under warm, wet conditions.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: Leaves appear lush green without spots or lesions.
No rust pustules or mold growth.
Grape___Black_rot: Small brown leaf spots with black edges.
Infected berries shrivel and turn hard black.
Disease spreads rapidly in wet conditions.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Leaves show tiger-striped yellow and brown patterns.
Dark streaks develop in the wood.
Berries shrivel and display black spotting.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Irregular dark brown to black lesions on leaves.
Spots merge causing leaf drying and fall.
Grape___healthy: Leaf surface is smooth, vibrant green, and clean.
No visible lesions or fungal growth.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): Fruits remain green, small, and misshapen.
Tree shows twig dieback and reduced vigor.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Small water-soaked spots on leaves that darken.
Severe infection leads to premature leaf drop.
Peach___healthy: Leaves are smooth, green, and free of blemishes.
Tree grows vigorously with healthy fruit set.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Small, water-soaked spots that turn brown and scabby.
Fruit lesions become dark and sunken.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: Leaves are firm, shiny, and deep green.
Plant displays strong fruiting and growth.
Potato___Early_blight: Dark brown concentric target-like rings on older leaves.
Yellowing begins from leaf edges inward.
Reduces leaf area and tuber yield.
Potato___healthy: Leaves are bright green, evenly colored, and firm.
No spotting, yellowing, or mold present.
Potato___Late_blight: White mold appears on undersides in humid weather.
Rapid foliage collapse and tuber rot occur.
Raspberry___healthy: Leaves are lush, green, and well-formed.
Soybean___healthy: Leaves are uniformly green with smooth texture.
No yellowing, spotting, or pest damage.
Strong stem and balanced canopy growth.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: White powdery patches appear on leaf surfaces.
Leaves yellow, curl, and dry out over time.
Favored by warm, dry conditions with poor ventilation.
Strawberry___healthy: Leaves are deep green with no spots or scorch.
Flowers and fruits are bright and firm.
Plant shows steady growth and vigor.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Purple spots appear, turning brown in the center.
Leaves curl and die under severe infection.
Reduced plant vigor and fruit production.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.
Leaves turn yellow and drop early.
Fruits develop raised, rough scabby spots.
Tomato___Early_blight: Dark concentric spots form on older leaves.
Yellowing spreads from bottom leaves upward.
Causes defoliation and reduced fruit yield.
Tomato___healthy: Leaves are green, smooth, and upright.
No signs of curling, mold, or pest damage.
Tomato___Late_blight: Large irregular gray-green patches on leaves.
White mold on underside in humid conditions.
Fruits develop brown, firm rotted areas.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Yellow spots on upper surface with olive mold beneath.
Leaves curl, dry, and fall off.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Small circular spots with dark edges and pale centers.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider: Tiny yellow specks and fine webbing on leaves.
Leaves bronze, curl, and dry out.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Circular brown lesions with concentric rings.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Mosaic light and dark green leaf pattern.
Fruits are small and unevenly ripened.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Young leaves curl upward and turn yellow.
Growth becomes stunted with reduced yield.
Transmitted by whiteflies in warm regions.
Unknown___Unrecognized_leaf: Leaf not identified in trained crop database.
Try uploading a clearer image or supported crop leaf.
